result.execSummary:
The defendant Josue Arnaldo Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order [Modifiers: Penalty-Ignition/Immob. Device Tampering], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Columbia County Court Conviction DNA Report - DNA taken
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant

9:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Josue Arnaldo Rivera in court. Defendant stated he does not plan to get an attorney. Would like to accept the offer. 9:15 Court in recess, case will be recalled. Defendant will fill out the proper paper work for plea/sentencing today. 9:34 AM  Case recalled appearances the same. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2 & 3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 1, 4, & 5 dismissed but read in. Sentencing statements. Court sentenced the defendant on count 2 to pay $642.00 fines/costs and submit DNA sample. On count 3, court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 days in jail, this is a time served sentence, $243.00 costs. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 2 days sentence credit. 9:43 AM
Return date on May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Josue Arnaldo Rivera in court. Defendant does not plan to have an attorney. State said he did not sign the paperwork stating he is not getting an attorney so no offer was given. Defendant is to stop at the DA office and sign the waiver form. 9:53 AM
Return date scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial 3-25-22 at 10:10 am and Return date 4-5-22 at 10:00 am
Return date on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 25, 2022 at 10:10 am.

9:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Josue Arnaldo Rivera appeared in court. Defendant stated he did not want an attorney. Had stated at the pretrial he wanted an attorney. Will call the SPD office to see if he qualifies. 9:30 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Return date scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
for a pretrial conference 2/4/22 at 11:10 A.M. and return date 2/22/22 at 9:15 A.M.
standard misdemeanor conditions,  not operate motor vehicle w/out valid D.L., not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Josue Arnaldo Rivera appeared by video, in custody from the Columbia County Jail w/Atty Gibson Hatch. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $1,000.00 sign bond, standard misdemeanor conditions,  not operate motor vehicle w/out valid D.L., not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia,
